documents.title: diageo to challenge £ 107m tax bill
text: drinks giant diageo is to be hit with a £ 107m bill for tax and interest by hm revenue & customs .
diageo says it will challenge the move .

the new diverted profits tax regime came into effect in april 2015 , and imposes a 25 % 'diverted profits ' tax on profits generated by multinational corporations within the uk which are then `` artificially shifted '' outside in order to pay lower tax .
under this regime hmrc is requiring diageo to pay additional tax and interest of about £ 107m in total for the financial years ended 30 june 2015 and 30 june 2016 .
in a statement diageo said it did n't believe that it falls within scope of new diverted profits tax regime .
it said it would `` challenge the assessments when they are received '' .
it added that `` based on its current assessment , diageo considers no provision is required in relation to diverted profits tax '' .
it also said the issue does n't change diageo 's expectation that its tax rate before exceptional items for year ending 30 june 2017 will be approximately 21 % .

documents.title: just eat must justify takeover , says regulator
text: online takeaway ordering firm just eat faces a potential full-blown investigation into its takeover of rival hungryhouse amid concerns the deal could curb competition .

the competition and markets authority said its initial probe into the acquisition - worth up to £ 240m - found the two firms were close competitors because of the service they offer and their reach across the uk .

it said other rivals offering delivery services , such as deliveroo , ubereats and amazon restaurants , provided little direct competition because they target different types of restaurant and did not have the same scale of service .

`` the cma is therefore concerned that the loss of competition resulting from the just eat/hungryhouse merger may result in worse terms for restaurants using either of the two companies , '' the regulator said .
it will now refer the deal to an in-depth competition investigation , unless just eat can address the concerns .
just eat has until 17 may to put forward proposals .

documents.title: a hard brexit decision to make
text: the rolling hills of county armagh seem an unlikely flashpoint in the looming brexit negotiations .
but the border between northern ireland and the republic , which runs through farms , roads , and even houses has emerged as a crucial issue in the talks .
`` it 's two countries , but really the economy of the island of ireland is , in most respects , one economy , '' said ellvena graham , vice-president of the northern irish chambers of commerce .

the cross-border trade is particularly strong in farming ; one-third of northern ireland 's milk production is handled in the republic , while the same proportion of irish pigs cross the border for processing in northern irish factories .

some academics and economists suggest that the eventual solution may be to recognise the porous nature of the northern ireland border and shift the hard frontier back to airports and ports in england , scotland and wales .
such a solution , anathema to hard-brexiteers , might make northern ireland a sought-after business location , one enjoying , by accident of history , the best of both worlds .
read dominic 's feature in full .
author: Dominic O'Connell
Business Presenter, BBC Radio 4 Today programme

the broadband company reported a £ 133m pre-tax profit for the year , up from £ 107m for 2016 , but said it expected earnings to fall again this financial year as it invests to attract new customers .
the firm suffered a major hacking attack in 2015 which saw its profits halve that year .

documents.title: pager plug pulled
text: vodafone is pulling the plug on its paging division - just hours after competition regulators queried a planned sale to capita , the other major uk player in market .
earlier , the competition and markets authority said it had serious concerns about the sale to capita .
pagers - although a pretty old technology - are still used by hospitals and the emergency services because of the long battery life , coverage and reliability .
vodafone has now decided to pull the sale and close the operation later this year .

the firm said : `` we are disappointed with the decision by the competition and markets authority this seems to be a surprising decision considering that this market has been contracting for some time and no other country in europe has more than one wide area paging network .

due to the expense involved with a prolonged investigation , vodafone will not pursue the transaction and has made the decision to close down this business , which is based on ageing , standalone technology no longer supported by network vendors . ''
some 1,000 customers still use the service , vodafone added .

documents.title: if dyson built houses
text: architect george clarke has been gracing the bbc airwaves and tv screens this morning , talking about the housing shortage .
the construction industry says it needs a quarter of a million new workers over the next three years to deal with the housing shortfall - but it 's struggling to achieve that .
clarke , an architect who presents channel 4 's amazing spaces , says young people do n't dream of working for building firms .
they want to work for google , facebook , or dyson - `` people who are really pushing the boundaries '' , he says on 5 live .
instead , construction firms need to think 30 years down the line , and imagine what james dyson or terence conran would build , he says .

documents.title: barratt 'making hay '
text: barratt developments ' shares remain the stand-out gainer on an otherwise lacklustre day so far on the ftse 100 .
a bullish update from britain 's biggest householder sent the share price up more than 4 % .
hargreaves lansdown equity analyst george salmon says barratt has been a `` good news '' story for some months .
`` conditions certainly look favourable for the builders at present , '' he says .

`` on the whole , doubts over the disruption brexit might cause are disappearing into the rear-view mirror , while low interest rates and numerous government schemes , including help-to-buy and the lifetime isa , continue to lend support .

`` of course , conditions wo n't stay so favourable forever , but a solid-looking balance sheet and continued improvements in operational efficiency should mean barratt is well placed to make hay while the sun shines . ''

documents.title: staley 'fighting for his job '
text: it 's no exaggeration to say that barclays boss jes staley is in a fight for his job , says bbc business editor simon jack .
staley 's attempts to uncover a whistleblower are being investigated by the financial conduct authority and the prudential regulation authority , which are part of the bank of england .
if it was just down to shareholders , he 'd probably be ok because of his success at improving barclays ' results , simon says .
but the bigger question is whether he 'll retain the confidence of the regulators .
`` the arched eyebrow of the bank of england can see off any chief executive , '' he says .
author: Simon Jack
BBC Business Editor

documents.title: sterling close to seven-month high
text: the pound has strengthened this morning .
a 0.3 % rise against the dollar has put it within a whisker of $ 1.30 , a rate not seen since last september .
sterling is also up 0.15 % on the euro at €1.1911 .

documents.title: barratt tops ftse
text: housebuilder barratt has gone straight to the top of the ftse 100 leaderboard at the start of trading .
shares in britain 's biggest housebuilder are up 2.7 % after it said full-year profits would be at the top end of expectations .
next is the second biggest riser - gaining 1.6 % - after analysts at investec upgraded its stock .
despite the rises , the ftse is pretty much flat at 7344 points , with most of europe 's major stock markets unchanged so far .

sacking of # fbi director james comey caused a `` a wobble in asian trade '' says @ twitterid jane foley # wakeuptomoney .

documents.title: snap judgement
text: it 's a big day for snapchat owner snap , which posts its first earnings as a public company today .

the bbc 's north america technology reporter dave lee has been looking at what to expect from a company whose share price surged 44 % on the first day of trading - giving it a market value of $ 33bn .
read dave 's piece here .

documents.title: toyota annual profit slides 21 %
text: japanese carmaker toyota has reported a 21 % fall in annual profit for the year to march - the firm 's first fall in profit in five years .
toyota has also said that earnings for the current financial year will come in lower , citing the strength of the japanese currency .

documents.title: aviva sale
text: insurance giant aviva has sold three of its life and pensions joint ventures in spain for €475m ( £ 403m ) .
the uk company had been reviewing operations in the country after a restructuring of the spanish banking system following the financial crisis .
aviva chief executive mark wilson called the sale `` a strong outcome '' .
you can read more about the disposal in the aviva statement .

documents.title: dunstone gets 'hands on '
text: sir charles dunstone says he 's `` enjoying having a more 'hands on role ' '' at talk talk as he tries to turn around the telecoms firm he founded 15 years ago .

sir charles returned to the business , which was hit by a major data breach in 2015 and faces fierce competition in broadband , as executive chairman earlier this year when longstanding chief executive dame dido harding departed .
`` my focus for the company is growth , cash generation and profit - in that order , '' sir charles , who also founded carphone warehouse , said this morning .
talk talk 's revenue fell 3 % to £ 1.78bn last year , but it managed to start growing its customer base again in the final quarter , according to its preliminary results .

documents.title: pager probe ?
text: plans to merge britain 's two main suppliers of paging services may face an in-depth competition probe .
capita hopes to buy vodafone 's pager arm , but the competition and markets authority has serious concerns .
pagers , a decades-old technology , are still used by many people because of the reliability , coverage and battery life .
in a statement , the cma says the two companies must find `` acceptable ways of addressing competition concerns '' to avoid an investigation .
`` capita and vodafone both supply wide-area paging services to customers , including emergency services and hospitals , '' the regulator says .

documents.title: itv ad drop-off
text: itv says the lack of a major football tournament this summer will contribute to an 8 % -9 % fall in advertising revenue in the first half of the year .
in june , ad sales on its tv channels are expected to be down 15 % to 20 % `` against the tough comparator of the euros last year '' when portugal won the tournament (
however , the broadcaster has left its guidance for the year unchanged , with online ad sales and income from its tv studios making up for the fall .

documents.title: barratt bullish
text: britain 's biggest housebuilder , barratt , has updated the markets this morning about trading .
chief executive david thomas says the business has had a strong couple of months `` both operationally and financially '' .
forward sales are at a record , and are up 12.7 % on this time last year , barratt says in a statement .
and the all-important profits guidance ?
`` we now expect full-year profit before tax to be at the top of the range of current analyst estimates , '' thomas says .
expect the shares to tick up at the start of trading .

documents.title: executive pay : iod calls for action
text: investors should be given a bigger say in executive pay in the uk 's biggest companies under moves to rebuild trust in business , directors are urging .

the institute of directors says today that if 30 % of investors oppose a remuneration report at an annual meeting , the company should have another look at its pay policy and allow shareholders a fresh vote .
the iod notes that despite some high profile rebellions in recent months , executive pay is usually waved through at an agm .
the next government should take action to force stock market listed firms to give shareholders a second vote if a significant minority rejected a pay report , said the iod .

oliver parry , head of corporate governance at the iod , said : `` uk company boards have been put under unprecedented scrutiny in recent months , with the government and the house of commons business committee suggesting reforms to executive pay and the governance of private companies .
`` business has been facing a crisis of public confidence since the financial crisis , and the political impetus to intervene will not disappear , whoever is elected . ''

documents.title: brexit means brexit ?
text: for tourists scratching their heads - and willing to open their wallets - about what exactly brexit means , they can now pay thousands of pounds for a brexit-themed package holiday .
for £ 4,600 , the six-day `` brexit means brexit ! ''
tour of london takes in westminster , the city , supreme court and a talk on british foreign affairs .
steven erlanger , who 's leading the tours , tells wake up to money it 's something that `` goes beyond the tower of london , the ravens and the tea '' .
and it 's generated enough interest for the newspaper to add a second version , adds mr erlanger , the london bureau chief of the new york times .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: farming today
text: today presenter dominic o'connell has been in northern ireland this morning taking the pulse of business .
not surprisingly , brexit is the major concern .
for both the manufacturing and farming sectors , the inability to plan properly until a trade deal - or not - is sorted is a big worry .
even small farms need a three or four year window to plan long-term , says barclay bell , president of the ulster farmers ' union .
a hard border with the republic would make life `` very difficult '' given that 30 % of milk and 40 % of sheep meat heads south from ni each day .
farmers , bell says , `` are very fearful about brexit negotiations and they have fears about access to markets and skills '' .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: staley made 'honest mistake '
text: shareholders are set to grill barclays boss jes staley later about his controversial handling of a whistleblower .

oliver parry , head of corporate governance at the institute of directors , says the bank 's chief executive made an `` honest mistake '' - a phrase that barclays itself used when it announced financial regulators were investigating mr staley .
still , shareholders will need ask questions today about the incident - that 's what annual general meetings are for , mr parry tells wake up to money .
`` it 's not simply to sit there and nod things through . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: us earnings boost asian markets
text: a handful of asian markets are all in the plus column , tracking us market gains after another record close on wall street , where investors were focused on strong quarterly earnings from corporate america .
japan 's nikkei 225 index was up 0.18 % at midday , as a drop in the yen boosted buying in exporters ' shares .
australia 's resource-heavy s & p asx 200 saw a gain of 0.43 % driven by the overnight uptick in oil prices .
in hong kong the hang seng index rose 0.8 % , meanwhile china 's shanghai composite saw a 0.26 % gain .
but the south korean market was the exception in the region .
the kospi index was down 0.7 % on profit-taking after liberal politician moon jae-in won the presidential election .
he was sworn in earlier in the day .

documents.title: standard-aberdeen job cuts
text: uk fund managers standard life and aberdeen have published detailed plans for their blockbuster £ 11bn merger .
the scottish firms reveal that about 800 jobs will go as part of `` efficiency savings '' .
the 163-page prospectus , published last night , says that the jobs could be cut from the firms ' combined 9,000 workforce within three years of their looming tie-up .
it also confirms that aberdeen boss martin gilbert ( and standard life chief keith skeoch will be joint chief executives of the new firm , unsurprisingly called standard life aberdeen .

documents.title: good morning
text: barclays boss jes staley is set to come under fire at the bank 's annual general meeting this morning .
some shareholders will mark their displeasure at mr staley 's handling of a whistleblower , which has seen him come under investigation by financial regulators .
elsewhere , talk talk and itv have trading updates out , and later on we 'll have maiden results from snapchat owner snap since its $ 24bn listing on the us stock market .
